Detailed Description

Time management

React on and handle time events

Member Function Documentation

void RODOS::TimeEvent::activateAt ( const int64_t  time)

Defines the time point when the method handle will be called one time.

Parameters:
timeTime to activate time event.
void RODOS::TimeEvent::activatePeriodic ( const int64_t  startAt,
const int64_t  period 
)

Like activateAt, but will be reactivated cyclic with the given period.

Parameters:
startAtFirst time when the time event is activated.
periodThe gap time between two activations of the time event.
virtual void RODOS::TimeEvent::handle ( void  ) [inline, virtual]

Handle the event. The default implementation of handle search for all threads waiting on this event. This is the case, if the thread calls Thread::suspendCallerUntil with parameter signaler a pointer to this event. The user can overload the method with an own processing of the event.

Warning:
1 Handle is running in the context of the caller, maybe an interrupt handler. So do it very short and avoid blocking functionalities inside the implementation of handle like semaphores, IO activities and so on.
See also:
Thread::suspendCallerUntil

Definition at line 139 of file timeevent.h.

virtual void RODOS::TimeEvent::init ( void  ) [inline, virtual]

The method is called once at system init during start up of the system.

Definition at line 144 of file timeevent.h.

static int32_t RODOS::TimeEvent::initAllElements ( ) [static]
static int32_t RODOS::TimeEvent::propagate ( const int64_t  timeNow) [static]

Calls all time event handlers which eventAt < now (past) and updates eventAt.

Warning:
the execution order of event handlers for one timeslot is NOT guaranteed. If events A and B have similar schedule times with t(A) < t(B) it could happen, that B is handled before A.
Returns:
the number of handle() called

Definition at line 76 of file timeevent.h.

int64_t RODOS::TimeEvent::eventPeriod [protected]

Periodical activation time of the event. If set to 0, the event is activated only once, else it is activated with a period of this time.

Definition at line 82 of file timeevent.h.
